intro: Hieracium subextracticeps, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Hieracium subextracticeps is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
